definition: to herald the break of day
dawn/daybreak/to know/to let sb know/to make explicit

sentences.english: The hound hunted all night. He quit when the roosters started crowing at daybreak.
sentences.chinese: 那隻獵犬忙乎了整晚，到黎明公雞報曉時才休息。

sentences.english: He gets up at the crow of the rooster every day.
sentences.chinese: 天亮了，我聽到從某處傳來雄雞的報曉聲。

sentences.english: It was dawn, and I could hear a cock crowing somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 天亮了，我聽到從某處傳來雄雞的報曉聲。

sentences.english: Cock crows in the morn. To tell us to rise.
sentences.chinese: 公雞報曉是爲了讓我們起牀。

sentences.english: The cock crows and the dawn chorus begins.
